item.title: 美元徘徊在八周低点附近，非农测试迫在眉睫
item.description: 周五，在一份至关重要的美国就业报告公布之前，美元徘徊在八周低点附近，该报告将为美联储的降息时机提供线索。【原文：The dollar hovered close to an eight-week low on Friday, ahead of a crucial U.S. jobs report that should provide clues on the timing of Federal Reserve interest rate cuts.】

item.title: 欧佩克+安抚市场，欧洲央行降息，油价攀升
item.description: 在欧佩克+成员国沙特阿拉伯和俄罗斯表示准备暂停或撤销产量协议，以及欧洲降息引发美国采取类似行动的前景之后，周五油价继续攀升。【原文：Oil prices rose on Friday, continuing to climb after OPEC+ members Saudi Arabia and Russia indicated readiness to pause or reverse output agreements and as an interest rate cut in Europe raised the prospect of a similar U.S. move.】

item.title: Netflix 面临 1.7 亿美元的 "驯鹿宝宝 "诽谤诉讼
item.description: 周四，Netflix 被一名苏格兰妇女起诉，索赔至少 1.7 亿美元，该妇女称自己在热播迷你剧《驯鹿宝宝》中被描绘成跟踪狂，因而遭到诽谤。【原文：Netflix was sued on Thursday for at least $170 million by a Scottish woman who said she was defamed over her portrayal as a stalker in the hit mini-series "Baby Reindeer."】

item.title: 穆迪发现保险公司未来几年将增加私人信贷风险
item.description: 穆迪评级公司（Moody's Ratings）的最新报告显示，全球保险公司计划在未来几年进一步投资于不断增长但不透明的私人信贷市场。【原文：Global insurers plan to invest further in the coming years in the growing but opaque private credit market, according to a new report by Moody's Ratings.】

item.title: 三星电子工会将于周五举行首次罢工
item.description: 韩国三星电子的一个工会将于本周五举行该科技巨头的首次罢工，但一些分析师预计，有关薪酬和条件的劳工行动不会对芯片生产产生重大影响。【原文：A Samsung Electronics union in South Korea is due to stage on Friday the first walkout at the technology giant, but some analysts did not expect the labour action over pay and conditions to have a major impact on chip production.】

item.title: 沃尔玛将在 2,300 家门店用数字价格屏取代纸质货架标签
item.description: 沃尔玛数千家门店将取消纸质货架价格标签。【原文：Paper shelf price labels are going away at thousands of Walmart stores.】

item.title: 空中客车公司五月份交付量下降 16
item.description: 空中客车公司（Airbus）周四表示，5月份交付了53架飞机，比去年同期下降了16%，使自1月1日以来交付给客户的飞机数量达到256架。【原文：Airbus delivered 53 aircraft in May, down 16% from the same month last year and bringing the number of airplanes handed over to customers since Jan. 1 to 256, the planemaker said on Thursday.】

item.title: Netflix 披露与 Skydance 合作动画片的新细节
item.description: Netflix 周四分享了即将上映的动画电影《咒怨》和《普库》的新细节，这两部电影是与 Skydance Animation 合作制作的。【原文：Netflix on Thursday shared new details about upcoming animated films “Spellbound” and “Pookoo,” which were made in partnership with Skydance Animation.】

item.title: 早间新闻印度利率决议为疯狂一周画上句号
item.description: 亚洲市场前瞻【原文：A look at the day ahead in Asian markets.】

item.title: 彭博社称赫兹考虑出售 7 亿美元担保债务及可转换债券
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周四援引知情人士的话报道，租车公司赫兹正在考虑出售至少 7 亿美元的担保债务和发行可转换票据，以巩固其资产负债表。【原文：Rental car firm Hertz is weighing a sale of at least $700 million in secured debt and a convertible notes offering, as it looks to shore up its balance sheet, Bloomberg News reported on Thursday, citing people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: S3 Partners称，针对英伟达的空头押注高达340亿美元
item.description: 在英伟达（Nvidia）有可能取代微软成为全球最有价值公司之际，至少有一些投资者押注其飙升的股价将重返地球。【原文：As Nvidia threatens to dethrone Microsoft as the world's most valuable company, at least a few investors are betting its soaring shares will return to earth.】

item.title: Emerson 将以 35 亿美元的交易向 Blackstone 出售谷轮合资公司的剩余权益
item.description: 工程解决方案公司 Emerson 周四表示，已同意将其在谷轮合资企业中的剩余权益出售给 Blackstone，交易价值约为 35 亿美元。【原文：Engineering solutions firm Emerson said on Thursday it had agreed to sell its remaining interest in its Copeland joint venture to Blackstone in a deal valued at about $3.5 billion.】

item.title: 华尔街对国库集中清算的时间表忧心忡忡
item.description: 在华尔街面临 2026 年最后期限之际，证券业和金融市场协会可能会要求监管机构给予更多时间来实施一项要求集中国债清算的规则。【原文：The Securities Industry and Financial Markets Association may ask regulators for more time to implement a rule requiring centralized Treasury clearing as Wall Street faces a 2026 deadline.】

item.title: 英国科技先驱迈克-林奇在美国欺诈案审判中被判无罪释放
item.description: 周四，旧金山的一个陪审团宣布 Autonomy 创始人迈克-林奇（Mike Lynch）欺诈罪名不成立，这对这位自 2011 年以 110 亿美元将公司出售给惠普公司（HP）的灾难性交易以来一直饱受法律问题困扰的企业家来说是一个重大胜利。【原文：Autonomy founder Mike Lynch was acquitted of fraud on Thursday by a jury in San Francisco, a major win for the entrepreneur who has been dogged by legal problems since the disastrous sale of his company to Hewlett-Packard (HP) for $11 billion in 2011.】

item.title: 消息人士称，New Era Cap 将收购生活方式品牌 47
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士周四表示，美国主要体育联盟头饰供应商 New Era Cap 已同意收购体育生活方式品牌 '47'。【原文：New Era Cap, a supplier of major U.S. sports league headware, has agreed to acquire sports lifestyle brand '47, people familiar with the matter said on Thursday.】

item.title: 瑞士信贷银行 AT1 债券持有人在纽约起诉瑞士银行
item.description: 美国法院周四的文件显示，一群持有瑞士信贷银行（Credit Suisse）价值 8,200 万美元的一级附加债务（AT1）的债券持有人已对瑞士提起诉讼，要求赔偿。【原文：A group of Credit Suisse bondholders holding $82 million worth of the failed bank's Additional Tier 1 (AT1) debt have filed a lawsuit against Switzerland seeking compensation, U.S. court filings on Thursday showed.】

item.title: 美国上诉法院将审理网络中立性法律挑战
item.description: 根据周四的一项命令，美国第六巡回上诉法院将审理一系列行业法律挑战，以阻止拜登政府恢复定于 7 月 22 日生效的具有里程碑意义的网络中立规则。【原文：The U.S. 6th Circuit Court of Appeals will hear a series of industry legal challenges seeking to block the Biden administration's reinstatement of landmark net neutrality rules set to take effect on July 22, according to an order Thursday.】

item.title: 咆哮的凯蒂猫 "即将发布现场直播，GameStop 大涨
item.description: 被称为 "Roaring Kitty "的在线股票影响者在 YouTube 上发布了他将在周五举行直播的消息后，GameStop 的股价在周四飙升了 30% 以上。【原文：Shares of GameStop surged over 30% on Thursday after the online stock influencer known as "Roaring Kitty" posted on YouTube that he would hold a livestream on Friday.】

item.title: Meta 的 WhatsApp 推出新的人工智能工具，帮助企业在聊天中锁定目标信息
item.description: Meta's 首席执行官马克-扎克伯格（Mark Zuckerberg）周四在巴西举行的一次会议上宣布，Meta's 首次在 WhatsApp 上为商业信息推出人工智能驱动的广告定向，试图从这项流行的聊天服务中榨取收入。【原文：Meta's on Thursday launched AI-driven ad targeting for business messages for the first time on WhatsApp, as it tries to wring revenue out of the popular chat service, Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg announced at a conference in Brazil.】

item.title: 独家报道智利科德尔科公司（Codelco）目标于 2030 年在马里昆加（Maricunga）锂矿区投产 - 文件
item.description: 据路透社周四披露的文件显示，Rothschild & Co 公司已正式开始评估与智利国营矿业公司 Codelco 合作开发一个大型新锂项目的候选者，该项目计划于 2030 年投产。【原文：Rothschild & Co has formally started to assess candidates to partner with Chile's state-run miner Codelco on a major new lithium project slated to begin production in 2030, according to documents seen by Reuters on Thursday.】

item.title: 降息希望升温，投资者排队购买美国高收益债券基金
item.description: 受较高收益率的诱惑、美联储降息预期带来的价格上涨潜力以及企业信贷风险下降的推动，美国高收益债券基金在 5 月份获得了今年以来最大的资金流入。【原文：U.S. high-yield bond funds enjoyed the biggest inflows of the year in May, driven by the allure of higher yields, potential for price appreciation amid anticipated Federal Reserve rate cuts, and diminishing corporate credit risks.】

item.title: 价值 13 亿美元的英国诉讼指控亚马逊滥用小卖家数据
item.description: 亚马逊正面临着英国零售商提出的 10 亿英镑（约合 13 亿美元）的集体诉讼，这些零售商声称该在线市场滥用了他们的数据，以提高自己的市场份额和利润。【原文：Amazon is facing a one billion-pound ($1.3 billion) collective lawsuit from British retailers who allege that the online marketplace misused their data to boost its own market share and profits.】

item.title: 菲亚特预计新型混合动力 500e 小型车年需求量为 10 万至 11 万辆
item.description: 菲亚特集团一位高管周四表示，菲亚特新型混合动力 500e 小型车的市场需求约为每年 100,000-110,000 辆，因为该公司推出了更便宜的全电动车型（EV）。【原文：Market demand for Fiat's new hybrid 500e small car amounts to around 100,000-110,000 units a year, a group executive said on Thursday, as the company offers a cheaper version of its fully-electric model (EV).】

item.title: 英国法院决定飞机纠纷应在乌克兰而非伦敦审理
item.description: 伦敦高等法院周四裁定，保险公司和飞机租赁公司之间关于滞留在乌克兰的喷气式飞机的法律纠纷应在乌克兰而非伦敦审理。【原文：A legal battle between insurers and aircraft leasing companies over jets stuck in Ukraine should be heard in Ukraine rather than London, the High Court in London ruled on Thursday.】

item.title: 单通道飞机短缺，沙特航空转向空客和波音宽体飞机
item.description: 沙特航空集团发言人告诉路透社，由于飞机制造商面临窄体飞机生产名额的限制，该集团正在与空中客车公司和波音公司就订购宽体喷气式飞机以提高其产能进行谈判。【原文：Saudia Group is in talks with Airbus and Boeing over ordering wide-body jets to increase its capacity as planemakers face constraints in production slots of narrow-body aircraft, a spokesperson for the group told Reuters.】

item.title: 中国证券监管机构寻求缓解市场对退市风险的恐慌情绪
item.description: 中国证券监管机构周四表示，预计近期退市数量不会激增，此前投资者因担心中国政府淘汰实力较弱的公司而抛售小市值公司股票，导致这些公司被踢出市场。【原文：China's securities watchdog does not expect a near-term spike in delistings, it said on Thursday, after investors dumped shares in small-cap companies on fears they could be kicked off the market as Beijing weeds out weaker firms.】

item.title: 美国国家运输安全委员会主席称 2023 年的近距离碰撞可能是灾难性的
item.description: 美国国家运输安全委员会主席周四表示，如果没有货运公司飞行员的行动，2023 年 2 月在得克萨斯州奥斯汀发生的联邦快递飞机与西南航空公司飞机险些相撞的事故可能会酿成大祸。【原文：The chair of the National Transportation Safety Board said Thursday the February 2023 near-collision between a FedEx plane and a Southwest Airlines jet in Austin, Texas could have been catastrophic without the actions of the cargo carrier pilots.】

item.title: Lyft 预测，到 2027 年，总预订量将每年增长 15
item.description: Lyft 在首次投资者日上表示，到 2027 年，Lyft 的总预订量目标是每年增长 15%，并补充说，预计同期其新兴广告业务的总预订量将增长 8 倍。【原文：Lyft is targeting 15% annual growth in gross bookings through 2027, the ride-hailing firm said at its inaugural investor day, adding that it expects gross bookings from its nascent advertising business to increase eight-fold in the same period.】

item.title: 美国四月份贸易逆差扩大
item.description: 美国 4 月份的贸易赤字有所扩大，原因是进口的大幅增长超过了出口的小幅增长。【原文：The U.S. trade deficit widened in April as a jump in imports outpaced a slight increase in exports.】

item.title: 星巴克与食品配送平台 Grubhub 合作
item.description: 星巴克（Starbucks）将与 Grubhub 合作，从本月起在美国部分市场提供咖啡和其他定制饮品，这是星巴克扩大业务范围的最新尝试，因为受通货膨胀影响，越来越多的顾客选择在家用餐。【原文：Starbucks will partner with Grubhub to deliver coffees and other customized beverages in select U.S. markets starting this month, in its latest attempt to widen its reach as inflation-hit customers are increasingly opting to eat at home.】
